transcript: Manga reader here - the way I interpreted it is that he's a gender non-conforming man. That seems to be how he sees himself and I think it's also what the creator intended. If he was a (trans) woman he would still be conforming to gender roles, but being a man who likes feminine things breaks gender roles. His character is all about doing what you love even if it goes against society's expectations, which ties into some of the overarching themes of the story. The fanbase seems to be generally in agreement that him being a GNC man makes the most sense with the message his character conveys. That being said, the whole "doing what you love even if it goes against society's expectations" thing is definitely something that resonates with a lot of trans people. I think it's a valid headcanon even if it's not necessarily what the creator intended.

I'm not in the US, so I can't help locally, but you can find all this stuff online or in stores like GNC or Vitamin Shoppe. Generally high quality whey protein powders will contain mostly whey protein isolate and usually little to no sugar. There may be some other sources like whey protein concentrate, but they should be listed after the isolate. Concentrate is cheaper and doesn't absorb or digest as well. So you gotta pay attention to the label, but many reputable brands will fit a keto diet without being expressly labelled as keto or low carb. I currently use Native Whey Protein Isolate Blend. It has 2 carbs per serving, one of which is sugar. I use it because its not loaded with fillers, flavors and other potentially nasty stuff. Its clean. Other popular brands I've used: Optimum Nutrition, Dymatize. Dymatize for sure makes and isolate blend with no sugar and tons of flavors. Anyway, you can get all this stuff online, probably amazon, just check the label and make sure its for the right flavor if buying online.

The Company develops robust technology solutions to solve customers' communications, safety, security and productivity problems. It develops rugged and reliable electronics solutions for government, corporate, NGO and consumer markets across the globe. The Company's segments include Communications, Metal Detection and Others. The Communications segment includes the design, development, manufacture, and marketing of communication solutions. The Metal Detection segment includes the design, development, manufacture, and marketing of metal detection equipment. The Other business segment relates to the manufacturing and sale of tracking products to Caterpillar Inc. Its metal detection business includes Minelab. Its Communications business includes Domo Tactical Communications and Zetron. The Company's products are sold in more than 150 countries with a global network of dealers, distributors and agents. It is Australia's largest Technology hardware & equipment company by market capitalisation. I've been a controls engineer (GNC) in the aerospace industry for the past 20+ years. I don't know how it is looked upon in other industries, but GNC engineers are generally at the top of the food chain in aerospace. I suspect it is a similar story in the robotics industry. Keep in mind that a good controls engineer will also be well-versed in modeling dynamic systems and programming at the very least. I can understand how you might become bored or restless if your work is restricted to PLCs. I wouldn't want to do that sort of work for too long either. So if you enjoy controls engineering, then start taking some graduate classes in the field and then look around for opportunities in other industries. A graduate degree may not be absolutely necessary, but it is definitely very useful if you want to do some "real" control design work.

As of 1:30 p.m. on the 18th, the top 1% of stock investment returns were confirmed to have net purchases of SK Hynix, GNC Energy, Hanwha Aerospace, HD Hyundai Heavy Industries, and Hyundai Elevator.The stocks net sold by ultra-high earners were Naver, Biol, Hyundai Motor, and Hanwha Ocean. Ultra-high players actively bought SK Hynix in the afternoon following the morning. This is interpreted as an improvement in investor sentiment as the draft tax reform proposed by the U.S. Senate included the expansion of tax credits for semiconductor companies. Ultra-super-highs also paid attention to GNC energy. This company is an emergency generator for AI data centers. With news that SK Group will build a massive AI data center on the site of Ulsan Mipo National Industrial Complex along with Amazon Web Service (AWS), the world's No. 1 player, it is believed that buying is flowing in as it is considered a related stock. GNC Energy recently signed a joint business agreement (MOU) with Doosan Fuel Cell to expand regional energy welfare. As the war crisis in the Middle East escalates, demand for weapons is expected to increase, and Hanwha Aerospace and HD Hyundai Heavy Industries have also been selected by ultra-high earners. On the other hand, ultra-high earners sold a lot of rain. Viol is a skin care medical device company that is listed on the KOSDAQ market. Recently, VIG Partners, a domestic private equity fund management company, will take over. It plans to make Biol a 100% subsidiary by making a tender offer of all remaining shares other than the management stake (34.76%) purchased by VIG Partners and voluntarily delisted. Naver, which produced the first artificial intelligence (AI) chief of the new government, saw its stock price rise sharply as its performance forecast rose, but ultra-high-level officials seem to have begun to realize profits.

The Eye Health Supplements Market is witnessing robust expansion driven by increased screen time use, demographic shifts toward older populations, and evolving consumer preferences for preventive nutrition. The industry size surpasses USD 3.2 billion in 2025, with personalized formulations and clean-label demand shaping industry trends and unlocking new business growth pathways. Market research and detailed market insights indicate that lutein, zeaxanthin, and omega-3 ratios are critical performance drivers, reflecting sophisticated market dynamics and offering significant market opportunities. Regulatory support for nutraceutical fortification further broadens the market scope, setting the stage for targeted innovations and enhanced industry share for brands that align with these evolving needs. Market Size and Overview The Global Eye Health Supplements Market size is estimated to be valued at USD 3,257.1 Mn in 2025 and is expected to reach USD 5,474.5 Mn by 2032, exhibiting a CAGR of 7.7% from 2025 to 2032. Eye Health Supplements Market Size report highlights opportunities across preventive care and functional nutrition segments. Growing incidence of digital eye fatigue (affecting over 60% of adults by 2024) and rising disposable income in APAC are primary market drivers. Despite potential market restraints related to pricing sensitivity, strong market revenue projections and a favorable regulatory environment support sustained market growth. This comprehensive market size and market report offers executives strategic insights into evolving market trends and market forecast directions. Market Segments Eye Health Supplements Market is segmented by product type, distribution channel, and end user. Product type sub-segments include vitamins (lutein, zeaxanthin), minerals (zinc), carotenoids, and omega-3 fatty acids. Vitamins dominated revenue share in 2024 with nearly 40% of total market revenue, while omega-3 recorded the fastest growth at a 12% year-on-year rise in 2025. Distribution channels—pharmacies, online retailers, and direct-to-consumer subscriptions—saw pharmacies leading in 2024, but DTC models surged 18% in 2025. End users include adults, seniors, and healthcare institutions; adults held the largest market share in 2024, while senior adoption grew at a 15% CAGR in 2025. These insights into market segments clarify the Eye Health Supplements Market size by category. Market Drivers Rising digital eye strain and a rapidly aging global population are the foremost market drivers. A 2024 survey found 65% of professionals report symptoms consistent with digital eye fatigue, fueling demand for preventive supplements. Concurrently, supportive regulatory policies in the EU and North America have approved nutrient fortification standards, unlocking new market opportunities. Government initiatives promoting dietary guidelines further stimulate product innovation. While pricing sensitivity poses a significant market restraint, the overall market growth is bolstered by enhanced consumer awareness and expanding healthcare budgets. Detailed market dynamics underline how these drivers will sustain CAGR and mitigate market challenges through 2032. Segment Analysis Focusing on the product type segment, vitamins led revenue performance in 2024 with USD 1,300 Mn, driven by high consumer trust and clinical validation of lutein-based formulations. The omega-3 fatty acid sub-segment demonstrated the fastest growth trajectory, achieving USD 200 Mn in revenue by 2025, boosted by Bausch Health's gelcaps case study. This segment analysis underscores that fortified formulations with proven bioavailability continue to capture market preference. Detailed market analysis reveals that companies prioritizing clinical trials and targeted marketing campaigns saw a 10–15% uplift in quarterly sales during 2024–2025, emphasizing the competitive edge conferred by science-backed products. Consumer Behaviour Insights End users increasingly prioritize personalization, sustainability, and convenience. A 2024 Nielsen survey reported 58% of purchasers willing to pay a 10% premium for clean-label, sustainably sourced ingredients. Euromonitor data from 2025 shows 70% of consumers research formulations through digital channels before purchase, highlighting the shift toward e-commerce. Subscription-based purchasing models grew by 22% in 2025 as consumers seek automated replenishment. Price sensitivity remains critical—25% of buyers switch brands if discounts are unavailable—posing a market challenge. These market insights illuminate evolving decision-making patterns and indicate that brands addressing customization and ethical sourcing will achieve superior business growth. Key Players Key market players driving innovation and expansion include copyright Inc, Bausch Health Companies Inc, Alcon, Alliance Pharma PLC, Allied Blenders & Distillers, Roche, Novartis, Amway, GNC, Nature's Bounty, Herbalife, Nutrilite, Puritan's Pride, Carlson Labs, and Life Extension. In 2024, copyright Inc launched a high-lutein capsule that delivered a 15% uplift in quarterly sales. Bausch Health expanded production capacity in Germany by 25% in early 2025 to meet European demand. Alcon entered the Latin American market in Q3 2025, resulting in a 12% regional revenue increase. These market players have leveraged strategic capacity expansions, product innovations, and regional entries to solidify their competitive positions and enhance Eye Health Supplements Market revenue. Key Winning Strategies Adopted by Key Players Bausch Health's 2024 deployment of an AI-driven personalization platform analyzed consumer health data, boosting repeat purchases by 18% and reshaping the Eye Health Supplements Market share dynamics. In 2025, Alcon introduced microencapsulation technology for lutein, increasing bioavailability by 25% and reducing dosage frequency, which led to a 20% sales jump in Q2. copyright's blockchain-based supply-chain traceability system rolled out in late 2025 enhanced consumer trust, driving a 12% lift in subscription conversions. These innovative, technology-led approaches exemplify powerful market growth strategies that competitors can adapt for differentiated offerings and accelerated business growth. FAQs 1. Who are the dominant players in the Eye Health Supplements Market?...

C4® Local Legends AUSTIN, Texas, June 18, 2025/PRNewswire/ -- As temperatures rise and summer sports kick into high gear, Nutrabolt, owner of C4 Energy®, one of the fastest growing energy drink brands in the country, is proud to further its mission of fueling performance at every level. Through its new C4 Local Legendsinitiative, C4 is committing $400,000 to support sports leagues, clubs, and teams nationwide this summer - giving athletes of all skillsets the opportunities to play, train, and celebrate like C4 superstar athletes including Saquon Barkley, Bijan Robinson, and CJ Stroud. In line with the recent ® campaign, C4 is on a mission to provide athletes everywhere with top tier support. This summer, C4 is calling on local athletes to nominate a deserving team for the chance to receive funding to help cover the needs that matter most, from gear and equipment to travel and registration fees. Whether hitting the field for fun or fueling a competitive edge, C4 is here to help make this the strongest, sweatiest summer yet. Selected teams will receive sponsorship packages designed to elevate their game, on and off the field. This initiative is about providing meaningful support to local legends, ensuring everyone has the opportunity to perform at their best all summer long." This crisp, nostalgic twist on a summertime favorite is packed with 200mg of caffeine, clinically studied CarnoSyn® Beta-Alanine, and zero sugar or carbs, engineered to help athletes of all kinds squeeze the most out of every rep. Like all C4 products, Classic Lemonade is NSF Certified for Sport® and meets the highest standards for quality, safety, and performance, making it a trusted choice for competitive athletes and everyday achievers alike. I (23, AFAB) recently started having an identity crisis and suddenly realized I'm probably some flavor of trans/NB. In middle school, while figuring out my sexuality, I explored my gender a lot too: experimenting with binding, packing, using masculine names and pronouns, etc. I thought I was nonbinary and potentially transmasc for a while, but didn't tell anyone aside from a few friends. When I came out as a lesbian, I kinda just attributed all of my gender issues to that and kinda forgot about it. Now ten years later here I am going through yet another identity crisis. I have been struggling a bit with my sexuality recently and a few months ago I realized that I'm really uncomfortable being viewed as a woman in a sexual context. That triggered me to start questioning my sexuality and gender all over again. It started with me obsessively reading books about gender and memoirs written by nonbinary people and relating heavily to many's experiences. I've also started following a lot of trans individuals on social media and learning about others transition journeys. I decided to start exploring my own gender and expression again. I started wearing boxers and ordered my first binder, which have both felt incredibly affirming. I changed my pronouns on my socials to she/they; I'm ok with feminine pronouns but honestly I'd prefer everyone just use they/them. The problem is I'm really scared to tell anyone or fully come out. 1) I don't feel 100% certain and I'm terrified of being wrong or having "faked it" or something, which I know is silly but I just can't get rid of the imposter syndrome. 2) I'm just really worried of not being accepted. I've identified as a lesbian for over 10 years now and a lot of people in my close social circle are heavily 'anti-man' and can be pretty exclusionary of non-women. I also feel a pretty strong pressure to fit in in terms of expression, especially at work. I'm a recent college grad and I'm currently searching for jobs and am worried that presenting more masculine or non-conventional will negatively impact my chances. I live in a pretty liberal area and am comfortable being open about my sexuality, but I know trans/GNC people tend to have a harder time. I just don't know what to do know. I have a few trans and NB friends but I don't really know how to talk to them about this. I want to experiment more with my gender expression but I'm afraid. I don't even know if I'm actually nonbinary or if I'm just playing into it cuz I feel lost. I like the idea of potentially taking testosterone and having top/bottom surgery but I just feel like I'm getting ahead of myself. I feel so confused and have no one to talk to about all of this and just don't know how to proceed from here.

Luton, Bedfordshire, United Kingdom, June 20, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The global liver detox supplement market is undergoing steady expansion, driven by growing consumer consciousness about liver health and rising incidences of lifestyle-related conditions such as fatty liver disease, excessive alcohol consumption, and poor dietary habits. In 2024, the market is valued at approximately $1.5 billion. Projections indicate that by 2034, the market will nearly double, reaching an estimated $2.9 billion, reflecting a healthy Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 7.2% over the forecast period from 2025 to 2034. Download PDF Brochure: This upward trend is underpinned by evolving consumer preferences for natural and preventive healthcare solutions, particularly those addressing liver function and detoxification. As modern lifestyles continue to strain liver health, consumers are increasingly turning to dietary supplements as a proactive strategy for maintaining well-being. Key Market Drivers: Preventive Health and Natural Solutions The rising awareness of preventive health practices has become one of the main pillars supporting the liver detox supplement market. With conditions like non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and chronic liver inflammation on the rise, consumers are seeking out daily supplements to support liver function and aid in natural detoxification. Public health campaigns and digital health education have also amplified the emphasis on liver health, reinforcing the market's growth. In particular, there is strong consumer interest in natural and organic ingredients. Supplements containing herbal components such as milk thistle, turmeric, dandelion root, and artichoke extract are gaining favor among individuals seeking plant-based remedies with traditional therapeutic backing. This preference aligns with the broader consumer movement toward holistic wellness, which prioritizes whole-body care through natural products. Additionally, the convenience of online shopping and the influence of wellness influencers have enhanced the accessibility and appeal of liver detox supplements. Brands leveraging digital marketing and e-commerce platforms are seeing accelerated market penetration, especially among younger demographics like millennials and Gen Z. Product and Ingredient Preferences Product Type Trends Among the various product formats, capsules dominate the market due to their ease of consumption, precise dosage, and long shelf life. They are especially popular with working adults seeking a simple and consistent health solution. Powders, though representing a smaller segment, are gaining popularity with health enthusiasts who prefer customizable dosing and the ability to blend supplements into smoothies or other beverages. Liquid extracts are also emerging as a notable category, favored for their faster absorption rates and herbal appeal. These products resonate particularly well with consumers who seek fast-acting results or have difficulty swallowing pills. Tablets and other formats continue to play a supporting role, offering variety for consumers with specific preferences. Leading Ingredients The market's most widely used ingredient is milk thistle, recognized for its potent antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that support liver regeneration and function. It is backed by significant scientific literature and consumer trust, securing its place as the top-selling liver detox ingredient globally. Turmeric, known for its curcumin content, is gaining significant momentum for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits. It is often positioned as a complementary or alternative ingredient to milk thistle in liver health formulations. Other herbal components such as dandelion root, artichoke extract, and N-acetyl cysteine (NAC) are also expanding their footprint due to their liver-supportive properties and traditional use in holistic medicine systems. Distribution Channels and Consumer Segments E-Commerce Driving Accessibility The rapid rise of online retail has transformed the way consumers purchase liver detox supplements. Platforms like Amazon, health-focused e-retailers, and brand-owned websites are seeing an increasing share of sales. The online segment is expected to be the fastest-growing channel through 2034, thanks to its unmatched convenience, product variety, and ability to educate consumers directly. Health food stores continue to appeal to consumers who prefer personal guidance and trust established wellness retailers. However, their growth is being outpaced by digital platforms. Meanwhile, pharmacies maintain their relevance due to their positioning as trusted health destinations, although their market share is expected to stabilize unless bolstered by stronger online integration. Supermarkets and direct sales models, including multi-level marketing and subscription services, also contribute to market diversity. These channels cater to more casual consumers and those drawn to convenience-based purchases. Target Demographics The adult segment is the largest consumer base for liver detox supplements, driven by growing concerns over stress, poor diet, and alcohol consumption. Marketing campaigns focusing on detoxification, energy levels, and general wellness strongly appeal to this group. Elderly individuals form another significant segment, as aging populations face a higher risk of liver-related issues and tend to incorporate supplements into daily health routines. Products targeting this group often emphasize joint health, digestion, and overall organ function in addition to liver benefits. Athletes and fitness-conscious individuals represent a fast-growing niche. Liver detox supplements are increasingly marketed as part of post-workout recovery and cleansing regimens. Endorsements by athletes and fitness influencers are effective tools in engaging this demographic. Formulation Preferences: Organic, Vegan, and Gluten-Free The global market is witnessing a noticeable shift toward organic, vegan, and gluten-free formulations. Consumers with dietary restrictions or those prioritizing clean-label products are seeking transparency and sustainability in supplement formulations....

It is backed by significant scientific literature and consumer trust, securing its place as the top-selling liver detox ingredient globally. Turmeric, known for its curcumin content, is gaining significant momentum for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits. It is often positioned as a complementary or alternative ingredient to milk thistle in liver health formulations. Other herbal components such as dandelion root, artichoke extract, and N-acetyl cysteine (NAC) are also expanding their footprint due to their liver-supportive properties and traditional use in holistic medicine systems. Distribution Channels and Consumer Segments E-Commerce Driving Accessibility The rapid rise of online retail has transformed the way consumers purchase liver detox supplements. Platforms like Amazon, health-focused e-retailers, and brand-owned websites are seeing an increasing share of sales. The online segment is expected to be the fastest-growing channel through 2034, thanks to its unmatched convenience, product variety, and ability to educate consumers directly. Health food stores continue to appeal to consumers who prefer personal guidance and trust established wellness retailers. However, their growth is being outpaced by digital platforms. Meanwhile, pharmacies maintain their relevance due to their positioning as trusted health destinations, although their market share is expected to stabilize unless bolstered by stronger online integration. Supermarkets and direct sales models, including multi-level marketing and subscription services, also contribute to market diversity. These channels cater to more casual consumers and those drawn to convenience-based purchases. Target Demographics The adult segment is the largest consumer base for liver detox supplements, driven by growing concerns over stress, poor diet, and alcohol consumption. Marketing campaigns focusing on detoxification, energy levels, and general wellness strongly appeal to this group. Elderly individuals form another significant segment, as aging populations face a higher risk of liver-related issues and tend to incorporate supplements into daily health routines. Products targeting this group often emphasize joint health, digestion, and overall organ function in addition to liver benefits. Athletes and fitness-conscious individuals represent a fast-growing niche. Liver detox supplements are increasingly marketed as part of post-workout recovery and cleansing regimens. Endorsements by athletes and fitness influencers are effective tools in engaging this demographic. Tablets and other formats continue to play a supporting role, offering variety for consumers with specific preferences. Leading Ingredients The market's most widely used ingredient is milk thistle, recognized for its potent antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that support liver regeneration and function. It is backed by significant scientific literature and consumer trust, securing its place as the top-selling liver detox ingredient globally. Turmeric, known for its curcumin content, is gaining significant momentum for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits. It is often positioned as a complementary or alternative ingredient to milk thistle in liver health formulations. Other herbal components such as dandelion root, artichoke extract, and N-acetyl cysteine (NAC) are also expanding their footprint due to their liver-supportive properties and traditional use in holistic medicine systems. Distribution Channels and Consumer Segments E-Commerce Driving Accessibility The rapid rise of online retail has transformed the way consumers purchase liver detox supplements. Platforms like Amazon, health-focused e-retailers, and brand-owned websites are seeing an increasing share of sales. The online segment is expected to be the fastest-growing channel through 2034, thanks to its unmatched convenience, product variety, and ability to educate consumers directly. Health food stores continue to appeal to consumers who prefer personal guidance and trust established wellness retailers. However, their growth is being outpaced by digital platforms. Meanwhile, pharmacies maintain their relevance due to their positioning as trusted health destinations, although their market share is expected to stabilize unless bolstered by stronger online integration. Supermarkets and direct sales models, including multi-level marketing and subscription services, also contribute to market diversity. These channels cater to more casual consumers and those drawn to convenience-based purchases. Target Demographics The adult segment is the largest consumer base for liver detox supplements, driven by growing concerns over stress, poor diet, and alcohol consumption. Marketing campaigns focusing on detoxification, energy levels, and general wellness strongly appeal to this group. Elderly individuals form another significant segment, as aging populations face a higher risk of liver-related issues and tend to incorporate supplements into daily health routines. Products targeting this group often emphasize joint health, digestion, and overall organ function in addition to liver benefits. Athletes and fitness-conscious individuals represent a fast-growing niche. Liver detox supplements are increasingly marketed as part of post-workout recovery and cleansing regimens. Endorsements by athletes and fitness influencers are effective tools in engaging this demographic. Formulation Preferences: Organic, Vegan, and Gluten-Free The global market is witnessing a noticeable shift toward organic, vegan, and gluten-free formulations. Consumers with dietary restrictions or those prioritizing clean-label products are seeking transparency and sustainability in supplement formulations....

Additionally, the convenience of online shopping and the influence of wellness influencers have enhanced the accessibility and appeal of liver detox supplements. Product and Ingredient Preferences Product Type Trends Among the various product formats, capsules dominate the market due to their ease of consumption, precise dosage, and long shelf life. They are especially popular with working adults seeking a simple and consistent health solution. Powders, though representing a smaller segment, are gaining popularity with health enthusiasts who prefer customizable dosing and the ability to blend supplements into smoothies or other beverages. Liquid extracts are also emerging as a notable category, favored for their faster absorption rates and herbal appeal. These products resonate particularly well with consumers who seek fast-acting results or have difficulty swallowing pills. Tablets and other formats continue to play a supporting role, offering variety for consumers with specific preferences. Leading Ingredients The market's most widely used ingredient is milk thistle, recognized for its potent antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that support liver regeneration and function. It is backed by significant scientific literature and consumer trust, securing its place as the top-selling liver detox ingredient globally. Turmeric, known for its curcumin content, is gaining significant momentum for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits. It is often positioned as a complementary or alternative ingredient to milk thistle in liver health formulations. Other herbal components such as dandelion root, artichoke extract, and N-acetyl cysteine (NAC) are also expanding their footprint due to their liver-supportive properties and traditional use in holistic medicine systems. Distribution Channels and Consumer Segments E-Commerce Driving Accessibility The rapid rise of online retail has transformed the way consumers purchase liver detox supplements. Platforms like Amazon, health-focused e-retailers, and brand-owned websites are seeing an increasing share of sales. The online segment is expected to be the fastest-growing channel through 2034, thanks to its unmatched convenience, product variety, and ability to educate consumers directly. Health food stores continue to appeal to consumers who prefer personal guidance and trust established wellness retailers. However, their growth is being outpaced by digital platforms. Meanwhile, pharmacies maintain their relevance due to their positioning as trusted health destinations, although their market share is expected to stabilize unless bolstered by stronger online integration. Supermarkets and direct sales models, including multi-level marketing and subscription services, also contribute to market diversity. These channels cater to more casual consumers and those drawn to convenience-based purchases. Target Demographics The adult segment is the largest consumer base for liver detox supplements, driven by growing concerns over stress, poor diet, and alcohol consumption. Marketing campaigns focusing on detoxification, energy levels, and general wellness strongly appeal to this group. Elderly individuals form another significant segment, as aging populations face a higher risk of liver-related issues and tend to incorporate supplements into daily health routines. Products targeting this group often emphasize joint health, digestion, and overall organ function in addition to liver benefits. Athletes and fitness-conscious individuals represent a fast-growing niche. Liver detox supplements are increasingly marketed as part of post-workout recovery and cleansing regimens. Endorsements by athletes and fitness influencers are effective tools in engaging this demographic. Are you one of those who first discovered Ashton Hall through those viral videos where the first thing he does after waking up is dunk his face in a bowl of ice, rub it with a banana peel, apply a charcoal peel-off mask, sip on Saratoga Spring water, go for a swim, and say “Thank you” every few seconds? While many know him today for his disciplined routines and motivational energy, few realize his humble beginnings. Back in 2019, Ashton Hall was juggling odd jobs before landing a role at GNC. By 2020, he had become a gym trainer, eventually managing a gym before quitting to pursue private in-person training. That same year, he launched his online coaching and content creation journey. Fast forward to 2025, Ashton Hall has positively impacted millions, and counting. Now, why bring up his story? Well, if you're active on social media, chances are you've seen Ashton Hall's regular uploads showcasing his skincare regimen and healthy lifestyle. But beyond that, he's also known for his high-octane race videos, often sprinting against cars or horses to prove his unmatched speed and power, a challenge he believed no one could top. That is, until recently, when a new contender, Darren Jason Watkins Jr., famously known as IShowSpeed, completely flipped the script and stunned viewers by beating Ashton at his own game. Just a few weeks ago, IShowSpeed and Ashton Hall went head-to-head in four separate races, and to everyone's surprise, the younger and lighter Speed won all four. The aftermath wasn't easy on Ashton Hall. He posted a now-viral video on Instagram, which has racked up over 108 million views. In the clip, tears streamed down Ashton Hall's face as he watched a replay of his loss, only to smash the TV screen in a moment of rage and disappointment. Despite the heartbreak, he composed himself, got dressed, and carried on with his day. The caption read, “We fell short, but we keep going,” a reflection of how deeply the defeat had affected him. Now, in an unexpected twist, Logan Paul thinks he can succeed where Ashton Hall failed. During the latest episode of the BS w/ Jake Paul podcast, the co-host made a bold statement: “I think you are great. I think you are genuinely the best in WWE. I think you are the most entertaining. [But] I think that you would get f—— dusted by Speed. I think you get dusted the same way Ashton Hall did. I think he's fast as f—. He's young. I think if you raced him four times, you'd lose four times. And I love you as a brother. I think you're incredibly athletic.” Logan Paul didn't take offense. He admitted, “I'm not offended at all. [IShowSpeed] is fast as fuck. But I am faster.” The challenge was immediately embraced by the podcast crew. “Let's make it happen,” the co-host said. The Maverick, while acknowledging the absurdity of the claim at 30 years old, added, “Me saying I am faster than Speed is absurd because I don't know if I am ever going to be able to beat that up.” But then came the twist. Logan Paul said he would race the 20-year-old. But with a condition. Which is? “I would do it if I could train and if for some reason, enough people get interested in their race, and we would like 1 million behind it, I am, I'm f—— in,” he declared. Jake Paul chimed in with some brotherly teasing, asking, “So you'd just train for two weeks to strengthen your head?” Logan Paul confidently replied, “Yeah, I would train for like a little bit.” Whether or not the race ever materializes remains to be seen, but Logan Paul certainly isn't shutting the door on the idea. And given that Jake Paul recently hinted at a potential fight with his own brother, it's clear the Paul brothers aren't afraid to take on even the wildest challenges. Jake Paul has one condition for fighting Logan Paul The revelation came during a nearly two-hour episode of The Iced Coffee Hour just days ago. When host Graham Stephan asked Jake Paul if he would ever fight his brother Logan, the 28-year-old hesitated. “Man, I don't think so. I really don't think we will fight,” The Problem Child said at first. But moments later, he reconsidered, hinting that a Paul vs. Paul clash could happen, though only under one specific condition. The host called it “one of the most anticipated events,” visibly disappointed by Jake Paul's initial reluctance....

(gnc = gender non conforming, i.e, self expression outside of the gender binary or contrary to it - nonbinary identites, transgender identities, etc.. .) honestly, a few years back i could totally understand the reasonings for not adding male/gnc player characters. it truly was a different climate for female gaming, and sso made a stance on that. it reflected in their story and their marketing, and i think at the time that was completely reasonable. however, we are not in the 2010s anymore. times have changed drastically where we now live in a world where inclusion is much more prevalent than before. the gaming world has changed so much to where the argument of "all main characters in games are always male" just simply doesnt apply anymore. the fact that sso still keeps up this argument that they made a decade ago to excuse ignoring a signifigant part of their playerbase while STILL trying to tailor to that demographic through pride bows and inclusive language is frankly so disappointing. (and the fact that fans - mostly misandrist and lgbtq+phobic women to be honest - keep parroting this narrative) the most common arguments against male/gnc player characters have always been; 1. video games almost always force you to play as only a male protaganist, so to combat this sso forces you to play as a female protagonist. 2. ssos story is about a sisterhood, therefore a male character simply wouldnt work for the story. 3. the majority of ssos playerbase/horse enjoyers in general are female. 4. sso should stay female focused only as a safespace for women and to keep men out. let me go into detail on each of these, 1. video games almost always force you to play as only a male protaganist, so to combat this sso forces you to play as a female protagonist. i mentioned the first point earlier, but id also like to note that you dont solve inequality with *more* inequality. when this statement was made - literally 2011 - it rang true. most games which didnt let you customize your character forced you to play as a male protaganist, usually with a set personality and character. even so, i dont see how turning the lack of gender inclusion on its head would solve the issue. now instead of women feeling out of place in gaming, it would be the men or gnc people playing sso feeling left out. lots of people have felt discriminated against in star stable for not being women even though a large part of the horse community arent "horse girls". and again, gaming has changed so much nowadays to where this conversation isnt even relevant anymore. tons of games feature female or gender neutral protaganists and most just let you choose or customize. the argument just doesnt hold true anymore. 2. ssos story is about a sisterhood, therefore a male character simply wouldnt work for the story. back in the early days of the story, this statement definitely rang true. it was about 4 girls and their bond with eachother and their horses, the creator of jorvik was a girl and the saviour of jorvik (the player) was also a girl to fit into the already established soulrider sisterhood. however, with how much the story has changed over the years, its hard to say it still holds up. the game has gotten a lot more explicitly inclusive with it taking less focus on horse riding being a specifically female hobby, including a lot more male characters and the biggest thing of all; giving the player they/them pronouns for a period of time. im not even joking, there was a time a year or two back when every dialogue directed towards the player used they/them pronouns, most of which are still in the game. now, i dont know why they went back on this - nowadays only using she/her for the player - but thats neither here nor there. sso clearly has no intention of pushing the sisterhood narrative as much as they did in the 2010s. 3. the majority of ssos playerbase/horse enjoyers in general are female. thats true, sure, but that doesnt mean that there isnt a large portion that are male/gnc. if the lgbtq+ community has a large enough effect on the game to warrant pride items (which i love, by the way) then the male/gnc players - who probably rival the percentage of lgbtq+ players - deserve the representation too. 4. sso should stay female focused only as a safespace for women and to keep men out. adding the option to play as a male/gnc character will not take ANYTHING away from any woman playing the game. the playerbase wont change, the story wont change, all it does is make a signifigant and important part of our community feel heard and appreciated. i understand wanting a safespace online for women, but trust me, the community wont change whatsoever. if youre uncomfortable with the idea of men/gnc people being part of your community, look around....

Hello. These may be signs that you may be non-binary (NB. or enby) or gender non-conforming (GNC) or just like less feminine things. As for your interactions with your husband, they could be signs that you are non-binary or genderfluid, or that you enjoy non-vanilla / kinky sex. For each person the experience is different, the realization is different and the experience of being non-binary is different. You may want to purchase a book on gender from amazon or audible and/or read some of the threads in this subreddit to see if more of the discussions, experiences  and anecdotes may or may not resonate with you. In the end it is about what feels right, feels authentic, feels affirming to you. And non-binary and its many sub-labels are here to help you understand yourself, but it is up to you if you want to use any of the labels to describe yourself. One more thing - in describing yourself rather than cis-woman, you may want to use AGAB = assigned gender at birth (where your assigned gender does not matter to the post) and/or AFAB. = assigned female at birth. Good luck and the community is here to support you in your exploration and journey.

Acute inpatient rehabilitation provides concurrent medical care and intensive rehabilitation. We sought to describe the nature of types of medical complications and to identify the more frequent types of medical complications management in patients with cancer undergoing acute inpatient rehabilitation. We reviewed the records of all consecutive patients admitted to acute inpatient rehabilitation from September 1, 2017, through February 28, 2018. Presenting problem noted to be a significant change in medical status using the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' Evaluation and Management Service Guide was defined as a medical complication. We recorded demographic and clinical characteristics. Multivariable logistic regression analysis was performed to assess prognostic factors for returning to acute care. Among 165 evaluable patients, 158 (96%) had at least one medical complication, and 31 (19%) had an unplanned return to acute care. After excluding three patients who had planned return to acute care, there was a cohort of 162 patients and the most common medical complication categories were electrolyte abnormalities 81 (50%), musculoskeletal 70 (43%), genitourinary or renal 61 (38%), hematologic 58 (36%), and cardiovascular problems 46 (28%). Multivariable analysis showed that tachycardia (odds ratio [OR], 7.83; 95% CI, 2.23 to 27.54; = .001) and weekly or more frequent RBC transfusions (OR, 5.23; 95% CI, 1.39 to 19.64; = .014) were independently associated with unplanned return to acute care. A high frequency and wide range of medical complications and interventions occur in patients with cancer undergoing acute inpatient rehabilitation. Close monitoring and expertise are needed for this patient population. Phosphatidylinositol-3-kinase (PI3K) inhibitors have shown activity in relapsed or refractory (R/R) indolent non-Hodgkin lymphoma (iNHL). PI3K inhibitors have been hampered by poor long-term tolerability and toxicity, which interfere with continuous use. Umbralisib, a dual inhibitor of PI3Kδ/casein kinase-1ε, exhibits improved selectivity for PI3Kδ compared with other PI3K inhibitors. This phase IIb trial was designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of umbralisib in patients with R/R iNHL. In this multicohort, open-label, phase IIb study, 208 patients with R/R marginal zone, follicular, or small lymphocytic lymphoma (MZL, FL, or SLL) unresponsive to prior treatments (≥ 1 MZL; ≥ 2 FL/SLL), including ≥ 1 anti-CD20-based therapy, were administered umbralisib 800 mg orally once daily until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or study withdrawal. Primary end point is overall response rate; secondary end points include time to response, duration of response, progression-free survival, and safety. nt-related discontinuations. Umbralisib achieved meaningful clinical activity in heavily pretreated patients with iNHL. The safety profile was manageable, with a relatively low incidence of immune-mediated toxicities and adverse event-related discontinuations.The 1980s and 1990s witnessed a surge of psychological research addressing the role of affect in social judgments. Evaluations of others were shown to be shaped, at least in part, by a person's incidental mood in the moment of social evaluation; while negative moods instigated negative interpersonal evaluations, positive moods instigated positive interpersonal evaluations. Interestingly, these effects only emerged when the reason for the evaluator's mood was not obvious. Over 30 years later, we expand these findings to the dyadic domain. Metabolism agonist Rather than conceptualize interpersonal evaluations as occurring solely within an individual, we introduce the Dyadic Affect Infusion/Diffusion (DAID) model to suggest that interpersonal evaluations occur as fundamentally dyadic phenomena. Using 6 weeks of daily diary data from 311 couples in which one member approached a stressful event, we show that (a) mood influences relationship evaluations at both the intraindividual (i.e., affect infusion) and interindividual (i.e., affect diffusion) levels, (b) both affect infusion and affect diffusion are turned off by the availability of attributional information, and (c) these effects are better explained by affect infusion/diffusion rather than by several alternative mechanisms. Taken together, the DAID model bolsters the view that individualistic approaches to emotion and social cognition are insufficient and require theory and data at the dyadic and group levels of analysis. (PsycInfo Database Record (c) 2021 APA, all rights reserved). This study quantified changes in self-reported sexual orientation from adolescence to early adulthood, and whether childhood gender nonconformity (GNC) predicted sexual orientation changes. Youth (2,678 boys and 3,359 girls; 96.09% ethnically White) from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children (ALSPAC) were included. Self-reported sexual orientation was measured using sexual attraction (5-point scale) at ages 15.5, 21, and 23. GNC was measured via Preschool Activities Inventory at ages 2.5, 3.5, and 4.75 years. The prevalence of boys and girls who reported being gay/lesbian increased from 15.5 to 21 years old whereas the proportion of bisexuals was relatively stable for both sexes. Among boys, heterosexuality and being gay were equally stable and relatively more stable compared to bisexuality. Among girls, reporting being lesbian and bisexual were equally unstable and relatively less stable than heterosexuality. Girls reporting being lesbian were more likely to report changes in their sexual orientation than gay adolescent boys. The stability of being lesbian and bisexual among girls, and bisexuality among boys, increased over time. Overall, few people changed their self-reported sexual orientation between ages 21 and 23. GNC at 2.5 years, and changes in GNC from 2.5 to 4.75 years, predicted being lesbian/gay at 15.5, 21, and 23 years and changes from being heterosexual to lesbian/gay from 15.5 to 21 years in each sex. In conclusion, self-reported sexual orientation from adolescence to young adulthood is relatively stable in males compared to females, and childhood GNC is a predictor of any, albeit small, sexual orientation changes. (PsycInfo Database Record (c) 2021 APA, all rights reserved).

The human brain is stupid. Just as stupid as your kidneys. It does what it is meant to be doing. And one of the things it is meant to be doing is being energy efficient. Binary thinking takes less effort, takes less energy, and is therefore so much easier to take on, especially as many basic survival instincts are still hard-wired into our responses. The process of deconstructing gender takes a certain amount of self-awareness, perhaps not on a level of spiritual awakening, but at least in a “Am I the problem?” Sort of way. So yeah, the gender binary is still much preferred for a lot of cis people because it's easier for their brains to handle. The hopeful thing is that, thanks to a lot of GNC people over the past few decades, more people are open to changing their minds, if they could get out of the damn echo chambers they have found themselves in. As for trans people, this is just my speculation, but I think that some of the trans people who are so adamant about binary gender identities are still running off of that old human survival need for community. Since the broader social structures still demand the binary, they may feel that anyone that falls outside of that binary are just causing problems for the sake of causing problems. Just my personal speculation. All we can really do is keep showing up as our authentic selves and letting that light lead other people to new ways of thinking. It's not like nonbinary people are a new thing. Maybe using the label “nonbinary,” or “gender non-conforming” or any label that falls under the NB umbrella, but we're not new. Case in point: the Universal Public Friend. Or were they the Public Universal Friend? I can never fully remember. That person was NB before NB was a “thing,” all the way back in the late 18th century.

LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM / ACCESS Newswire / June 23, 2025 / With age-related hormone decline becoming a major health concern for men, especially those in their 40s and beyond, the demand for safe and effective testosterone support solutions is on the rise. Among the many options available, TestoPrime is gaining widespread recognition as the best testosterone booster supplement for men over 40, 50 thanks to its natural formulation and evidence-backed results. Testosterone is essential for maintaining muscle mass, mental clarity, mood stability, and sexual vitality. However, studies indicate that men may experience up to a 1% drop in testosterone per year after age 30 . By the time many reach their mid-40s, symptoms like fatigue, weight gain, decreased motivation, and reduced libido become common. What Is TestoPrime? According to the official product website ( https:://testoprime.com/ ) TestoPrime is a daily dietary supplement crafted to naturally stimulate the body's own testosterone production . Unlike synthetic hormone replacement therapy (HRT), which introduces external testosterone and may suppress internal production, TestoPrimetestosterone booster works with the body's endocrine system, helping revive natural testosterone output without side effects or dependency . The product is manufactured in FDA-approved, GMP-certified facilities and undergoes stringent third-party quality testing. It is non-GMO, soy-free, vegan-friendly, and free from artificial fillers, making it accessible to a wide range of users. Key Benefits of TestoPrime Testosterone Booster: According to both clinical data and user testimonials, consistent use of TestoPrime may provide the following benefits: Boost in natural testosterone production (up to 44% increase in some users) Enhanced lean muscle mass and strength Improved fat-to-energy conversion and metabolic rate Reduction in stress levels by over 70% Higher VO2 max for better endurance and oxygen uptake Greater mental focus and reduced "brain fog" Increased libido and overall mood balance These effects are typically noticed within 3 to 6 weeks of daily supplementation and can be further enhanced by maintaining a balanced diet and exercise routine. TestoPrime Ingredients: Natural, Transparent, and Backed by Science TestoPrime features 12 carefully selected ingredients , Unlike synthetic hormone therapies, which can carry risks and side effects, Testo Primetestosterone booster offers a non-invasive, nutraceutical approach . Each ingredient selected based on scientific research into hormone regulation and male vitality. Key components include: D-Aspartic Acid (2,000 mg) - Stimulates the release of luteinizing hormone (LH), leading to increased testosterone synthesis in the testes. KSM-66 Ashwagandha (668 mg) - Clinically proven to reduce cortisol levels by up to 27%, enhancing hormonal balance and recovery. Panax Ginseng (8,000 mg) - Promotes nitric oxide levels, improving blood flow and stamina. Green Tea Extract (200 mg) - Contains catechins that support fat metabolism and inhibit testosterone degradation. Fenugreek Extract (800 mg) - Supports strength, libido, and energy through natural saponins. Pomegranate Extract (360 mg) - Helps combat oxidative stress and reduce inflammation in hormone-producing organs. Zinc (40 mg) - A critical mineral for testicular function and testosterone regulation. Vitamin D3 (26.68 mcg) - Deficiency in this vitamin is strongly associated with low testosterone levels. Garlic Extract, Black Pepper Extract, Vitamin B6, Vitamin B5 - Support digestion, nutrient absorption, and energy metabolism. Each ingredient has been dosed for clinical relevance, safety and the formula is manufactured in an FDA-inspected facility under strict GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) standards. The result is a formula that supports energy, mood, lean muscle growth, and metabolic function-without synthetic chemicals or hidden fillers. The Challenge: Testosterone Decline After 40 Medical research shows that testosterone production in men decreases by approximately 1% per year after the age of 30. This decline accelerates in the 40s and 50s, contributing to symptoms such as: Decreased muscle mass and slower recovery from workouts Reduced libido and sexual performance Increased abdominal fat and a sluggish metabolism Poor concentration, low confidence, and persistent fatigue While these symptoms are common, they are not irreversible. TestoPrime addresses these issues naturally, helping men regain their edge with a clean, evidence-backed supplement designed for long-term use. Why TestoPrime Is Ideal for Men Over 40 As the body ages, its natural testosterone production slows-often triggering a cascade of physical and mental health issues. For men over 40, this can manifest as: Reduced exercise performance and slower muscle recovery...

The result is a formula that supports energy, mood, lean muscle growth, and metabolic function-without synthetic chemicals or hidden fillers. The Challenge: Testosterone Decline After 40 Medical research shows that testosterone production in men decreases by approximately 1% per year after the age of 30. I'm a college student. I'm poc, ftnb (possiblly ftm?) , and autistic. I joined an online research program where I could choose from a bunch of projects. I went for the project that sounded the most interesting. But the project coordinator is a white man that teaches at a Midwestern university. I had my camera off during the introductory meeting. I was genuinely interested in this project and I thought I really clicked, so I went for it. Today, the coordinator asked everyone to turn their cameras on, which I did. Nothing overtly bad happened but I'm seeing a lot of "midwestern nice" and the professor almost seemed disappointed(?) that I'm not white. I have a feeling that the coordinator became less enthusiastic once he had visible confirmation that I am POC. Like he was engaging with white students but not with me. Idk though, my name gives my ethnicity away so they would have known that I am not white when they admitted me into this project. They also asked for pronouns. I was honest (because I already look really GNC) that I went by they/them. There was a visibly trans person in the zoom as well and quite a few GNC looking people in the room, but I'm also wondering if I put myself in danger with this choice. I'd already had a horrible experience with a white male professor who basically destroyed the first semester of my first year. It was so bad that I almost learned nothing from his class, got traumatized out of that entire academic field, and couldn't walk into that particular building for years. I don't want that garbage to repeat. I'm wondering if I accidentally put myself into a dangerous situation. I'm in STEM. I don't believe attempting to avoid white men (or women) is a sustainable strategy given the field and I've learned the hard way that POC aren't necessarily safe people. I genuinely want to study this field but I have great reasons to fear for my safety. I have a home country I can seek opportunities at, but said country is horrendously misogynistic, queerphobic ,and ableist to the point I can't really picture a professional future there. I'm autistic and people in my home country think all autistic people are "r******d" and never amount to anything beyond sheltered jobs that pay subminimum wage. They act like I'm either a foolish child or like my body is fundamentally wrong - it's jarring how they make me feel this way even in the absence of overt racism. I feel like I'm stuck between a rock and a horrible place, it's just horrific. I am fully aware how fucked up this is, but if I have to continue associating with my home country, the only way to gain any kind of respect is by brandishing (yeah I know it's fucked up) my association with whatever western country I can get access to. - What's a good balance to strike between pursuing my interest and planning for safety? - Any ideas for safety planning? I want to be able to focus on learning and growing but bigotry - both in my home country and by white supremacy - is making it impossible, it's fucked.

On the new site there's places to put your preferred name, forgive me if you've already tried this method! I'm GNC, and I created my NYRR account with my chosen name 🙈 at the UA half I was worried they'd not let me pick up my bib bc my ID doesn't match my chosen name (on top of being GNC, I'm adopted so I use my birth last name- long story with a history of my names lmao) but they understood and let me pick it up. I'm sorry you were told you couldn't have it changed to reflect your true identity/self- I know there are other runners similar to you/us that do not use our legal names! While I don't have direct advice, I hope you're able to get it sorted!

SPR_COMBO[ja]「血糖値管理用サプリメントのグローバル市場（2025-2032）」調査資料を販売開始 （株）マーケットリサーチセンタ－（本社：東京都港区、グローバル調査資料販売）では、「血糖値管理用サプリメントのグローバル市場（2025-2032）：製品種類別、エンドユーザー別、地域別」調査資料の販売を2025年6月24日に開始いたしました。 世界の血糖値管理用サプリメント市場規模（国内市場規模を含む）、動向、予測、関連企業の情報などが盛り込まれています。 ■レポート概要 ―――――――――――― レポート概要 本調査レポート「世界の血糖値管理用サプリメント市場（2025年～2032年）」では、2024年の市場規模を87億米ドルと推定し、2025年から2032年にかけて年平均成長率（CAGR）6.5%で成長すると予測しています。 2032年には約135億米ドルに達すると見込まれ、糖尿病罹患者の増加や予防医療への関心の高まりが市場を牽引します。 本レポートは、製品タイプ別、成分別、流通チャネル別、地域別に詳細なセグメント分析を行い、主要プレーヤーの戦略、規制動向、消費者ニーズの変化を評価しています。 ―――――――――――― 市場動向と成長要因 血糖値管理用サプリメント市場は、糖尿病患者や血糖値異常リスクを抱える消費者の自主管理ニーズに応える製品群から構成され、その主な成長要因は以下の通りです。 糖尿病罹患者および前糖尿病者の増加 世界保健機関（WHO）によると、成人の糖尿病有病者数は年々増加傾向にあり、予防・管理製品へのニーズが高まっています。 早期介入を目的とした血糖値モニタリングやサプリメント活用が広がっています。 予防医療・セルフケア意識の高まり 生活習慣病予防のため、医療機関通院以外で自宅で手軽に摂取できるサプリメントが支持されています。 特に持続的な摂取プランを提案するパーソナライズドサプリメントが注目されています。 天然由来成分への信頼 シナモンエキス、ビネガー成分、クロム、α-リポ酸、ベネフィシャル菌など、研究報告や臨床試験データに裏付けられた天然由来成分が消費者に受け入れられています。 副作用リスクを抑えた製品開発が進んでいます。 テクノロジー統合とデジタルヘルス モバイルアプリやウェアラブルデバイスと連携し、血糖値データをリアルタイムで追跡できるサプリメントサブスクリプションサービスが登場し、消費者エンゲージメントを高めています。 ―――――――――――― 地域別動向 北米市場 北米は市場をリードし、2024年に約40%のシェアを占めています。 米国では血糖値管理用サプリメントの機能性表示制度が整備され、シナモンカプセルやクロム含有製品などがドラッグストア、オンラインチャネルで広く流通しています。 カナダでは自然療法系ブランドが強みを持ち、健康食品専門店での販売が盛んです。 欧州市場 欧州では規制が厳格である一方、医療従事者推奨製品やオーガニック認証製品が人気です。 ドイツ、フランス、英国を中心に臨床データを活用した製品が成長しており、機能性飲料への添加タイプも増加傾向にあります。 アジア太平洋市場 アジア太平洋地域では、中国、インド、日本、韓国が主要市場です。 特に中国ではECプラットフォームを通じたD2C販売が約50%を占め、高齢化と都市化に伴う生活習慣病予防意識の高まりが市場拡大を後押ししています。 日本・韓国では伝統的素材であるシナモンや黒酢（アップルサイダービネガー）が注目され、健康飲料タイプでの需要が伸びています。 その他地域 南米や中東・アフリカ市場は成長初期段階ですが、都市部の高所得層を中心に高機能性製品の需要が見られます。 ブラジル、メキシコ、UAEでは専門店やオンラインチャネルを通じた製品導入が進んでいます。 ―――――――――――― 製品タイプ別分析 カプセル／タブレット型 最も広く利用される形態で、成分配合量を正確に管理しやすい点が評価されています。 シナモン抽出物、クロムピコリネート、α-リポ酸など多成分配合タイプが主流です。 パウダー／ドリンクミックス型 水やスムージーに溶かして摂取できる形態で、血糖値コントロールに加えビタミンやミネラルをプラスした総合栄養サポート製品が人気です。 リキッド／エナジードリンク型 即時吸収を狙った形態で、夜間の血糖値スパイク抑制用製品や、食後のサポートドリンクとして導入が進んでいます。 ソフトジェル型 油溶性成分（α-リポ酸やオメガ脂肪酸）を含む製品に採用され、摂取のしやすさと吸収効率を両立しています。...

Ibiza / Santiago, junio de 2025 – WINA Festival, el certamen internacional de creatividad que premia lo mejor de la publicidad independiente, ha anunciado oficialmente a los ganadores de la décima edición, la cual reunió a participantes de las Américas, Europa, Asia, África y Oceanía, destacando el crecimiento constante de la comunidad indie, que ha encontrado en este festival, un espacio de reconocimiento y proyección global. La décima edición de WINA, contó con dos encuentros muy especiales: el primero en Santiago el pasado 5 de junio en Renaissance, donde se presentaron algunos de los ganadores hispanos en una jornada de conferencias, foro y cena de premiación. Y el remate, de celebración, fue el pasado 13 de junio, con un cóctel de premiación al atardecer en el rooftop de Club Ushuaïa, donde posteriormente algunos asistentes continuaron en una fiesta en el icónico club del mismo nombre, con la presentación de Calvin Harris. WINA Ibiza 2025 no solo celebra una década de historia, sino que abre un nuevo capítulo en el que la independencia creativa continuará ocupando el lugar que merece en el escenario global. Algunos de los reconocimientos más importantes de esta edición incluyen a Joystick, FIFCO, como la agencia del año. Fifco con 122 puntos fue elegida la marca del año. España puso 2 agencias en el top 5 con con Officer & Gentleman (2) y Manifiesto (4). Por primera vez una agencia australiana ingresa al top 10 con Hero (6). También I-Dac Indonesia, logró que por primera vez una agencia asiática figurara entre los 10 mejores. Perú fue el país revelación del mundo independiente con 3 agencias entre los mejores. Yo, what's up? If you're looking to buy essential oils, you've come to the right place! First (EDITAPAPER) => vk.cc/cMZDnO off, let me tell you that essential oils are all the rage these days. They're used for everything from aromatherapy to cleaning to skincare. And the best part is, they're all natural and super versatile. So, where can you buy them? Well, there are a few options. You can buy them online, at specialty stores, or even at some grocery stores. Let me break it down for you. If you want to buy essential oils online, there are plenty of options. One of the most popular is Amazon. They have a huge selection of oils from a variety of brands, and you can usually get them at a pretty good price. Just make sure you read the reviews before you buy, so you know you're getting a quality product. Another great online retailer for essential oils is Vitacost. They offer a wide range of oils at competitive prices, and they often have sales and discounts. Plus, their customer service is top-notch. If you prefer to shop in person, you can check out specialty stores like Whole Foods or GNC. These stores usually have a good selection of essential oils, and the staff can often help you choose the right one for your needs. If you're looking for a more budget-friendly option, you can try your local grocery store. Many of them now carry essential oils in their health and wellness aisles. Just be aware that the selection might be more limited than at a specialty store. No matter where you decide to buy your essential oils, make sure you're getting them from a reputable brand. There are a lot of cheap knockoffs out there that won't give you the same benefits as the real deal. Look for brands that use high-quality ingredients and have good reviews from customers. And always do your research before you buy! So there you have it, my friend. A few options for where to buy essential oils. Whether you're looking to relax, energize, or just make your home smell amazing, there's an oil out there for you. Happy shopping! Yo, what's up folks? Glad to see you're interested in essential oils. They're dope for so many reasons, from relieving stress to boosting your immune system. So, where can you buy these amazing oils? There are a bunch of options, but let me break it down for you. You can find essential oils in health food stores, natural product stores, and even some grocery stores. Online shopping is also a great option as it gives you a wider selection of oils to choose from. If you're looking for a physical store, check out places like Whole Foods, GNC, and Vitamin Shoppe. These stores often carry high-quality essential oils from reputable brands. You can also find them in smaller, local stores that specialize in natural products. Just make sure to do your research and check the labels to ensure you're getting pure essential oils. If you're more of an online shopper, there are tons of websites that sell essential oils. Amazon is a popular choice, but be sure to read the reviews and choose a seller with a high rating. Other great websites include Plant Therapy, Rocky Mountain Oils, and Edens Garden. These sites offer a wide variety of oils and often have sales and discounts. Plus, you can read the reviews of other customers to get an idea of how well the oils worked for them. Another option is to buy essential oils directly from the brand's website. This is a great way to ensure you're getting authentic, high-quality oils. Brands like doTERRA and Young Living have their own websites where you can purchase their products. Just be aware that these brands can be on the pricier side. No matter where you decide to buy your essential oils, make sure to do your research and choose a reputable seller....

Companies in the United States have been known to support the Republican Party through donations, sponsorships, or public endorsements. These businesses often align with the party's pro-market policies, lower taxes, and deregulation stance though many businesses today are increasingly cautious about publicpolitical affiliations due to changing consumer expectations and political climates. Boycotting big companies can be a powerful tool for influencing corporate behavior, instead of just boycotting, some advocate for "buycotting"—actively supporting businesses that align with your values. BOCA RATON, FL, UNITED STATES, June 24, 2025 /EINPresswire.com/ -- As the Founder and CEO of Nutritional Products International (NPI), Mitch Gould's career has been defined by his innovation and expertise in bringing success to products debuting in the U.S. retail market; exciting times marked by growing Amazon.com's sports nutrition category from Ground Zero and resulting in the placement of some of the largest brands in the world. In the early 2000s, Gould, along with Muscle Foods, a leading sports nutrition distributor, stocked Amazon.com's new health and wellness platform with more than 100 high-quality, innovative brands and products. Upon realizing that brands, especially international companies, had trouble launching products in the U.S., Gould developed his 'Evolution of Distribution' platform which provides product manufacturers with all the services they require to enter the largest consumer market in the world with ease. “I'm still not resting on my past successes,” stated Gould, whose company, NPI, a global brand management firm based in Boca Raton, Florida, continues stocking the latest health and wellness products with online retailers nationwide. “We continue to add innovative health and wellness products to Amazon.com's virtual shelves while concurrently updating the 'Evolution of Distribution' model to meet the changing trends in the retail industry.” Gould added, “It is more important than ever to place our clients on e-commerce sites like Amazon.com and Walmart.com because the pandemic changed the shopping habits of consumers across the country.” “Consumers have returned to brick-and-mortar stores now that Covid is in the rearview mirror, but people remain accustomed to buying many more products online that they previously only bought in person. That trend will continue.” Gould has sold into such retailers as Costco, Walmart, Home Depot, Lowes, Vitamin Shoppe, Vitamin World, GNC, CVS, Rite Aid, just to name a few. Working with retail buyers and a myriad of online platforms is a core aspect of Gould's 'Evolution of Distribution' services. “I created the 'Evolution of Distribution' because many product manufacturers struggled when trying to enter the U.S. market,” Gould added. “The 'Evolution of Distribution' brings all the services brands need under one roof. NPI makes it easy for them because we offer sales, logistics, regulatory compliance, and marketing know-how in a simple to understand and cost-effective package.” “Instead of spending thousands of dollars, if not more, on renting office space, hiring sales staff, meeting FDA guidelines, finding warehouse space, and bringing onboard a marketing team, all they need is NPI,” Gould said. “We have the knowledge and experience to make their U.S. launch easy and successful.” For more information, visit www.nutricompany.com. MORE ON NUTRITIONAL PRODUCTS INTERNATIONAL (NPI) AND ITS FOUNDER MITCH GOULD: NPI is a privately-held company that specializes in the retail distribution of nutraceuticals, dietary supplements, functional beverages, and skin-care products. NPI offers a unique, proven approach for product manufacturers worldwide seeking to launch or expand the distribution of their products in the U.S. retail market. Mitch Gould, Founder and CEO, is a third-generation retail distribution and manufacturing professional. Gould, known as a global marketing guru, has represented icons from the sports and entertainment worlds such as Steven Seagal, Hulk Hogan, Ronnie Coleman, Roberto Clemente Jr., Chuck Liddell, Wayne Gretzky. Cult Beauty and Myprotein operator THG has said sales returned to growth in recent months as it brought its products to a growing number of stores around the world. Shares in the Manchester-based firm leapt higher after it said its nutrition business was growing at the fastest rate in more than three years. It told investors that revenue growth for the division – which also includes Myprotein's clothing arm, and Myvitamins – was expected to be between 5% and 7% for the second quarter. Myprotein products are now available in more than 34,000 stores, primarily in the UK, US and Japan, and it is expecting this to grow to 40,000 around the world by the end of the year. This has been boosted by expansion in the US with new listings in retail giant Walmart, pharmacy chain CVS, and expansion into additional GNC nutrition stores. It also said new listings had been secured at chains including thousands of 7-Eleven stores in Taiwan and Singapore, and in Dutch health and wellness gain Kruidvat. The company is anticipating in-store sales from the brand to be around £170 million for the full year. This is despite ongoing inflation across milk and whey prices – key ingredients for protein shakes and powder – but THG said there had been some recent signs of that starting to ease. Meanwhile, THG said sales across its beauty division were expected to decline by about 2% to 3% over the second quarter. This would nonetheless mark an improvement after sales dropped by a 10th in the first quarter. The beauty arm, which includes online retailers Cult Beauty and Lookfantastic, enjoyed growth in the UK but this was offset by the decision to withdraw from some less profitable locations in Asia and Europe. Shares in THG were soaring by more than 15% on Wednesday morning.

I just started this job. At will state. I sit at the door monitoring employees who enter and exit a large warehouse for theft of products. The warehouse is locked. It has 12 forklifts that travel the aisles at a fast rate of speed throughout the day. Since I am a contractor (security) who has worked Amazon and GNC in the past, I brought my own steel toe boots and hard hat. I was told do not wear them. Today, after one week, I was told I am not allowed to wear any hearing protection either. I can hear all the forklifts EASILY through foam earplugs and am worried about hearing loss at this point. The forklift path is 5 feet away for 10 hour days with continuous noise. Isn't it my right to protect my own hearing? The workers in the warehouse are allowed to listen to music as loud as they want so I do not see a difference. I could understand if I needed to hear a passing forklift but I am entirely stationary. Thoughts?

Halfords beats expectations after cost savings and price rises Halfords has revealed stronger-than-expected profits for the past year, supported by cost savings and pricing measures. The motoring and cycling retailer said it saw underlying pre-tax profits rise by 6.4 per cent to £38.4m for the year to 28 March, having previously pointed to profits between £32m and £37m. Recently appointed boss Henry Birch said it reflected a "strong" performance from the business and showed it had made progress with its growth strategy. The company sought to reduce costs in order to cushion the impact of inflation. Halfords told shareholders that it saw around £33m in cost inflation over the year, partly driven by the increase in the minimum wage. It said it had offset this through cost savings worth around £35m. Total revenues rose by 0.1 per cent to £1.72bn for the year, with like-for-like growth of 2.5 per cent. The firm's autocentres business saw like-for-like growth of 3.7 per cent, while retail sales were up by 2.1 per cent. Babcock hails 'new era of defence' driven by rising global threats Babcock International has hailed a "new era for defence", with rising global threats prompting governments around the world to strengthen spending, especially on the burgeoning nuclear sector. The company generated an operating profit of £364m in the year to the end of March, 51 per cent higher than in the previous year, while revenues grew by 11 per cent to £4.8bn. It also said it was now expecting to meet its target underlying operating margin in the next financial year - one year earlier than it previously thought. Babcock maintains the UK's fleet of submarines, and also provides engineering support across the marine, nuclear, land and aviation sectors. Tritax Big Box to buy rival Warehouse in £485m deal Distribution infrastructure firm Tritax Big Box has agreed a £485.2m deal to buy a London-listed rival, fending off a competing bid by private equity giant Blackstone. Warehouse REIT (Real Estate Investment Trust) said bosses have recommended the proposed takeover, which values Warehouse - which owns a raft of distribution sites run by companies including Amazon - at 114.2p per share. It comes weeks after Warehouse originally agreed to be bought by US private equity firm Blackstone for £470m. The firms said the move would deliver £5.5m a year in immediate cost synergies due to larger economies of scale. Barebells Protein Bar in der Sorte „Wild Cherry“🍒🍒 von barebells.usa 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀⇢ Dieser Barebells Riegel ist exklusiv bei der amerikanischen Supplement Store-Kette GNC erhältlich. Er besteht aus einer hellen Proteinmasse über der sich eine rosa Cremeschicht befindet. Umhüllt ist der Riegel mit weißer Schokolade und hellen Crispies. Echte Kirschen sind nicht enthalten. 𝗞𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘇⇢ Die Proteinmasse überzeugt mit einer super weichen, ja fast schon butterweichen Konsistenz und die dünne Cremeschicht präsentiert sich cremig. Die Crispies fügen ein angenehmes Knuspern hinzu und die dünne Schokohülle kommt zartschmelzend daher. 𝗚𝗲𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗺𝗮𝗰𝗸⇢ Die Schokohülle und die Proteinmasse sorgen für einen milchigen, vanilligen und süßen Grundton, welcher von einem leicht fruchtigen Kirsch-Joghurt-Aroma ergänzt wird. Durch die Kombination aus Kirsche & Joghurt wirkt dieses Aroma, trotz der Tatsache, dass keine echten Kirschen enthalten sind, tatsächlich nur wenig künstlich. 𝗔𝗹𝗹 𝗶𝗻 𝗔𝗹𝗹⇢ Insgesamt bekommen wir hier einen gelungenen Riegel mit einer echt tollen Konsistenz und einem leckeren Kirsch-Joghurt-Geschmack, gepaart mit weißer Schokolade. Für mich persönlich könnte er lediglich etwas fruchtiger sein. Außerdem könnte ich ihn mir auch mit Zartbitterschokolade echt gut vorstellen. Super schade, dass es diese Sorte nicht in Deutschland gibt! Meiner Meinung nach gibt es generell viel zu wenig Kirsch-Proteinriegel!
